Role_Model_Context: Indian cricket legend and one of the world’s leading batsmen.
Situation_Faced: He experienced emotional exhaustion and burnout, losing motivation and intensity before the 2022 Asia Cup.
Challenge_Narrative: Kohli admitted he was “faking” his trademark intensity because he felt mentally drained from nonstop cricket and overwhelming expectations. He lost excitement for practice and no longer felt present or connected to the game. The pressure to maintain an idealized image of strength made him suppress his real feelings
Key_Action_Taken: He stepped away from cricket for a month to reset mentally.
Key_Quote_or_Insight: When I sat down and thought about it I was like, 'wow, I haven't touched a bat for like 30 days
Summary_Psychological: His experience shows that burnout can distort motivation and identity even in high achievers. Recovery requires stepping back, respecting personal limits, and reconnecting with intrinsic motivation. Vulnerability enables genuine emotional reset.
Outcome_Resolution: He returned with renewed clarity, better emotional balance, and restored passion for training.
